author: salen
title: Oxford student hub
description: Cardano не хватает разработчиков, которые могли бы создать отличные решения для будущего

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal's team argues that Cardano lacks developers who are capable of building great solutions in the future, and they propose creating a hub at Oxford University to help attract high-performance students interested in learning both Haskell and Plutus. In my opinion, they present a fairly generic solution, but with a lot of potential given the profile of people attending Oxford; therefore, I agree with the alignment of the mission of the proposal with what they are looking for in this challenge. Based on a quick analysis of the success metrics presented, I believe that they are appropriate. One concern I have is that the team estimates they will retain one third of those who attend the community events proposed, and from my experience the retention percentage is usually much lower.
f6_assessments.q1: The team presents a description of its skills and experience, as well as references that can be used to verify them. This budget is broken down into identifiable line items, and sufficient information is provided to understand how the final amount requested was determined. The team presents a simple but effective plan that explains what it is proposing to do in order to bring this proposal to fruition. There is only one element that I consider important for this type of proposal that was not included, and that is the identification of potential barriers or risks to the success of the proposal. It would have been helpful if the team had addressed latent risks such as the dropout rate and presented counter proposals to address them. It would also have been helpful if the details of the curriculum of the educational program had been provided.
f6_assessments.q2: Lastly, the team does a good job of outlining their roadmap in three, six, and twelve months, outlining not only milestones but also success metrics. Both of which seem to be appropriate and incorporate everything that the team seeks to accomplish. In my opinion, one element that is missing from this type of proposal, that occurs in the "real world", is the consideration of improving transparency in the execution of the actions over the entirety of the implementation period.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposer wants to create a local hub that attracts programmers in Oxford university. I think that students are a really good  audience to target as their youth, their desire to conquer , and their energy are needed to build this ecosystem. These students will be introduced to the plutus and to the haskell programming language. The end goal is to grow the developper army in the cardano ecosystem. I think that this can have a great impact in the community. Furthermore, speaking about value, some of these students will certainly join the catalyst program where they can submit proposals, work as CA or VCA. Altogether, I have a positive note on the impact that this proposal will have in the cardano ecosystem, and I think that it should be able to scale in future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided evidence of relevant skills  (linkedin profiles) of the team members. The number of the team members are disclosed in the proposal. The budget has been broken down, and based on my sole intuition, I think that it is reasonable. However the proposer didn't outline a plan if additional funding is needed. Although it's not a make or break thing, I recommande to the proposer to consider adding a plan for future funds. 
Apart from that, the proposer has done a good job by providing a comprehensible timetable to complete the work. Altogether, the proposer is clear on what the project is all about. The plan shows clearly what is being built and all the resources necessary to achieve the goal. However, the proposer didn't consider in this proposal, the challenges and risks that they may face relevant to a successful implementation. Other than that, I believe highly  in the feasibility of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is auditable based on the information provided. The proposer has included a roadmap and milestone that can help track the progress of the project. The metrics and KPIs that define success are outlined in this proposal and they are pretty strong in my opinion. Altogether, the proposal checks all the boxes to be successfully audited. The problem that the proposer is trying to solve is described clearly and the solution as well.

f6_assessments.q0: You're back! And with a bang. Would not have started with that problem statement though :). Adoption through education is key. Cardano is not just undermarketed brand wise, their technology is also not well-known, add to that nature of Haskell that many view as an unpopular and difficult language. Though in actuality this language is used by various widely know entities such as Microsoft, Kaspersky Labs etc, By aligning with this proposal, it is a natural setup. Oxford, who till this day is still viewed as the congregation of the brightest minds 'deserves' the brightest technology. Cardano is that brightest technology with an even brighter humanitarian mission. These proposers are smack in the middle of the wealth of intelligence that Cardano can benefit from. Supporting theses proposers will introduce Cardano to the future developers. From a CA perspective, of the 5 (five) metrics provided in the Challenge, these proposer and their proposal fits 4 (four). To my fellow CA's and vCA's, please 5-star them. We need them.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have meticulously stated their experiences and backgrounds. One has a background in leading student bodies, one is prominent in digital strategy and business development, one is a deep understanding of blockchain and to round it off, one has interest in using technology to support social needs. Of the 4 (four) three have provided their LinkedIn links. This is an A-Team who will most likely implement their proposal successfully. Budget is broken down in detail with simple action plans adjoining to them. Though through this budget, a question does pop-up, the need to provide stipends to persuade the students to believe in the mission that is Cardano. I do understand that they are not there for Cardano, they are there to learn from Oxford. Although that's sad to hear that it boils down to that, it is gamble that we the community should take. Implementation plan is also clear and are accompanied with rationale, including the rationale of providing stipends. There is one part of their implementation plan I 100% believe in, partnering with the Oxford student societies. These proposers are pragmatic, a trait of future start-up founders, in their approach and being so usually yields results. Their rationale of partnering with student societies is spot on. Unfortunately though, they have not accounted for the risk and challenge they might be facing in during the duration of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a clear roadmap with milestones and additional action plans here and there, although it is jumbled together with the KPI's. Of the KPI's the can has been identified a large majority of them are measurable. Making this proposal on the easier side to audit. Problem statement might not be correct though but it is quite solid and well connected with the solution. Hence this sufficient and equally solid proposal. vCA's, let's gamble on this proposer, let's see what Oxfordian's are made of.
f6_assessments.reply: In Fund7 we need 3 months operating funds

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal that came from a group of students from a prestigious university like Oxford, and I am delighted with their participation. Because everyone can see that this is an old school, with a lot of experience in education. Therefore, the proposal to include the programming languages Plutus, Haskell.. will promote the cardano platform to have more talent, research and development expertise on cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: Although Oxford is a prestigious school and the students here are very creative and talented. However, the proposal should clearly indicate to which courses the scholarships are to be awarded, the criteria for not being biased, and why those students should be awarded the scholarship. Thank you very much!
f6_assessments.q2: I think this proposal, if possible, should be certified by the school board, and supported to ensure the transparency of the scholarship subsidy, the cost of the events organized. Instead of a spontaneous group of students and it is more difficult to double-check this proposal is to the right person, used for the right job or not.

f6_assessments.q0:
There is clarity in the problem, the solution and matching the challenge. The proposal wants to attract developers to grow the Cardano ecosystem by attracting young programmers choosing Haskell and Plutus at Oxford University by creating a student center.
Possibly the best proposal I've seen written so far! Definitely up to the challenge and seemingly scalable.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proponent seems to have enough knowledge and experience to create content as good as he is suggesting. The recommended group consists of 4 members, 3 out of 4 have provided LinkedIn to easily verify their authority. Besides, each person's abilities are rich, so they can complement each other. Further proof that I am confident in the feasibility of the proposal is that the team has a Fund6 winner on three proposals and community advisors.
 This is a very interesting idea, I believe they will be easy to implement because according to the description, the proponents are all students of the prestigious Oxford school, so it is easy to attract the attention of people. Other students come to Cardano by creating a scholarship that will help students invest more time and effort into learning more about the ecosystem to make their application more powerful. It would be great if the proposal anticipates the risks that may be encountered in implementing this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
A roadmap and key metrics have been presented that allow the success of the proposal to be assessed and monitored. Provides a 12-month roadmap with KPIs that make it easy to check your proposal's progress
The well thought out budget and extremely detailed explanation makes me completely agree that the team is competent enough to tackle the challenge.
KPIs and funds are transparent, and schedules for delivered products are a great way to track project progress.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a brilliant idea and I think the proposal will make high impact for Cardano community since it aims to build a hub of Oxford programming students. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge because it plans to build a potential community and make many students get onboarded Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
Because team members are Mphil and BSc candidates of Oxford universities, Fund 6 winner, CA, etc.,I think they are capable of running this project. Timeline and budget is clearly presented. 
I suggest team to consider some challenges may happen, like Covid-restriction or Oxford current conditions.
f6_assessments.q2:
Roadmap and milestones are coherent. Key metrics to success should be written separately from the roadmap. 
I think this proposal provides me very sufficient information to audit its progress and success. Kudos and goodluck to team!

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal from the Oxford students to form a hub fits within this challenges goal to increase Cardano community hubs.
f6_assessments.q1: The team of students has experience running student led organizations at Oxford in past and presents a compelling plan to develop an organization to lobby student programmers to adopt Plutus.
f6_assessments.q2: The information included in the team overview, timeline and budget sections of this proposal as well as the detailed plan are sufficient to audit this proposal.

solution: Создать студенческий хаб на базе Оксфордского университета, чтобы привлечь молодых программистов к изучению Haskell и Plutus.
experience: Студенты и аспиранты Оксфорда. Опыт руководства студенческими организациями.
